org.threadly.test.concurrent

Class TestCondition

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.threadly.test.concurrent.TestCondition

  • public abstract class TestCondition
extends java.lang.Object

    TestCondition in unit test, designed to check a condition for something that is happening in a different thread. Allowing a test to efficiently block till the testable action has finished.

    This tool is used often within threadly's own unit tests. Please use those as examples using this class.

    Since:
    1.0.0

      Thrown if condition is still false after a given timeout.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public abstract boolean get()
        Getter for the conditions current state.
        Returns:
        condition state, true if ready

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue()
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests. This uses a default timeout of 10 seconds, and a poll interval of 10ms

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue(int timeoutInMillis)
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests. This uses the default poll interval of 10ms
        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - time to wait for value to become true

      • blockTillTrue

        public void blockTillTrue(int timeoutInMillis,
                 int pollIntervalInMillis)
        Blocks till condition is true, useful for asynchronism operations, waiting for them to complete in other threads during unit tests.
        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - time to wait for value to become true
        pollIntervalInMillis - time to sleep between checks
